intro: Cypella grandis, commonly known as the large cypella, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
